text:
The American built his dream home of 11 freight containers
01 Nov 2019, 12:45 by Victor Podvolotsky
Three floors and an area of more than 200 square meters.
Speaking about the house of their dreams, not all people imagine a luxurious mansion or an expensive penthouse in the city center. There are those whose desires are more specific. So, the American designer Will Bro decided to abandon the traditional architecture and built a home of 11 freight containers.






His home is located on McGowen Street in Houston. According to the owner, this building is the largest of its kind.



The containers form a three-story structure, where there was a place even for a large open terrace.






Will Bro has been looking for help in building such a house since the 2000s. However, he never found a suitable designer, so he decided to do everything himself.


















According to the designer, transport containers are very strong, fireproof, durable and resistant to hurricanes. This makes them a very suitable resource for construction.






The total area of the dwelling was about 232 square meters. Inside there is a full kitchen-living room, bedroom, spacious toilet with shower and even a separate area for parrots.






More details about all stages of construction are available on the Will Bro website.
